intro: Atitara drudeana, commonly known as the white-leafed stiltgrass, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, which includes grasses, and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous white or pale green flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of grass family members. It thrives in moist, sunny environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its rapid growth and invasive potential, it can outcompete native vegetation in certain regions.
